brief_summary.textblock:
This Phase 1, open-label, randomized, 4-period crossover study is designed to de termine the
      relative bioavailability of GDC-0941 administered as a single dose o f the market image
      formulation at 3 different hardnesses (hardness 1, 2, and 3) and as a single dose of the
      Phase 2 formulation to healthy male and female volun teers. Participants will be randomly
      assigned to 4 possible treatment sequences, each comprising 4 periods (1 per formulation),
      and GDC-0941 will be administere d based on the assigned sequence. The study is expected to
      last 8 weeks.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of the Effect of Formulation and Tablet Hardness on the Bioavailability of Pictilisib in Healthy Volunteers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Male and female participants between 18 and 55 years of age, inclusive,

          -  Body mass index (BMI) between 18.5 to 32 kg/m2, inclusive,

          -  Healthy, as determined by no clinically significant findings from medical history,
             ECG, and vital signs, and who are able to swallow and tolerate a tethered Heidelberg
             pH Capsule and have gastric pH measurements taken

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Any medical condition or history of such condition that may, in the opinion of the
             investigator, contraindicate participation in this study

intervention.description: Single dose market image tablet of hardness 1
Single dose market image tablet of hardness 2
Single dose market image tablet of hardness 3

clinical_study.official_title: A PHASE 1, OPEN-LABEL STUDY TO EVALUATE THE EFFECT OF FORMULATION AND TABLET HARDNESS ON THE RELATIVE BIOAVAILABILITY OF PICTILISIB (GDC-0941) IN HEALTHY SUBJECTS

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration-time curve (AUC) of plasma GDC-0941
Relative bioavailability (Frel) according to the model independent approach

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Bio-availability Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
